title: Loops
content:
```

break
The break statement can be used to jump out of / end a loop.


continue
The continue statement is used to skip one iteration of the loop



return 
this keyword exits the current function

```


## For Loop

- can iterate in reverse
- determine a stopping condition
- you have access to indices of the elements
- and the ability to set a counter.
- can loop in pairs

```js 

const pokemonList = ['Pikachu', 'Charizard', 'Squirtle', 'Yoshi', 'Snorlax'];

for (let i = 0; i < pokemonList.length; i++) {
    console.log(pokemonList[i])
}

```


## For of Loop
- cannnot iterate in reverse
- you have no access to indices of the elements
- no need to declare lenght


```js   

const pokemonList = ['Pikachu', 'Charizard', 'Squirtle', 'Yoshi', 'Snorlax'];


for (const pokemon of pokemonList) {
    if (pokemon === 'Yoshi'){
        continue
    }
    console.log(`You caught a ${pokemon}!`)
}

```
